Top-3 Similar Questions: so_17184956: How exclude files / folders for remove

so_17184956: find . -type 'f' | grep -v "NameToExclude" | xargs rm 
find . -type 'd' | grep -v "NameToExclude" | xargs rmdir

Explanations about Options.-name:
This option is supported, but POSIX conformance depends on the POSIX conformance of
 the system's fnmatch(3) library function. As of findutils-4.2.2, shell
 metacharacters (`*', `?' or `[]' for example) will match a leading `.', because
 IEEE PASC interpretation 126 requires this. This is a change from previous
 versions of findutils.

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_15952823: How do I duplicate a folder and remove dotfiles and PSDs in the duplicate folder?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_15952823: cp -r working bak \
&& find bak/ -name ".*" -o -name "*.psd" -o -name "*.zip"|xargs rm \
&& tar czf working.tar.gz bak \
&& rm -r bak
